node.title: Alabama to Block Employers From Firing Unvaccinated Workers Who Seek Exemption
node.description: One of the medical exemptions under a bill approved by lawmakers is having already been diagnosed with COVID in the past 12 months.

node.title: Trump Pushes Back on Vaccines for Kids After Ben Carson Calls Shots 'Giant Experiment'
node.description: Jerome Adams, Trump's former surgeon general, said that along with health benefits, there's a "real social benefit" to kids being vaccinated.

node.title: Kansas' Democratic Governor Calls Biden's Vaccine Mandate 'Too Late'
node.description: "I don't believe this directive is the correct, or the most effective, solution for Kansas," Governor Laura Kelly said of Biden's vaccine mandate for employers.

node.title: Secretary of state appoints 2 diplomats to lead "Havana Syndrome" response
node.description: American diplomats and intelligence officers around the world continue to report symptoms.

node.title: Sister of condo collapse victim running marathon with first responder
node.description: Micaela Naibryf and Amnon Leibowitz are running the New York City Marathon​ in honor of Ilan Naibryf who died in the June Surfside building collapse.

node.title: How to watch longest partial lunar eclipse
node.description: The moon will move into Earth's shadow for 3 hours and 28 minutes this month.

node.title: Singing the Praises of R.B.G. Style
node.description: Bibhu Mohapatra and the Washington National Opera pay homage to the Supreme Court justice.

node.title: Should I Try to Save a Child From Her Adoptive Mom’s Bad Race Politics?
node.description: There’s one big thing to remember before your kids hang out.

node.title: N.Y.C. Rats: They’re in the Park, on Your Block and Even on Your Table
node.description: Reported rat sightings, health inspections finding evidence of rat activity and cases of a disease spread via rat urine are all up amid the pandemic.

node.title: The activist Vanessa Nakate offers an optimistic vision: ‘We won’t have to fight’ for resources.
node.description: The 24-year-old from Uganda has emerged as a leading voice of young people agitating for climate action.

node.title: Greta Thunberg assails world leaders for ‘profiting from this destructive system.’
node.description: “The governments of the global north countries are still refusing to take any drastic climate action,” she told protesters in Glasgow.

node.title: Massive 10-Foot Long Alligator Rescued From Drainage Ditch in Texas
node.description: Livestock deputy Damon Bailey was called to a pipeline site in Texas on Wednesday when contractors spotted the massive reptile.

node.title: Man With Cerebral Palsy Thrown Off Flight Because 'Wheelchair Was Too Heavy'
node.description: Brandon Aughton was then escorted back by airport officials and was able to re-book a flight and fly out late the next day.

node.title: 'Party of Parents': GOP to Build on Fight Against Critical Race Theory for Midterms
node.description: Republicans are planning to strengthen their campaigns against diversity-centered academia in the wake of Tuesday's elections.

node.title: '10 Firemen Later': Video Shows Aftermath of Costco Air Fryer Exploding in Woman's Home
node.description: The TikToker made a simple mistake which caused her air fryer to combust into flames, burning her stove and kitchen floor.

node.title: Internet Backs Deliveryman Allegedly Suspended for Popeyes Rats Video: 'Did Nothing Wrong'
node.description: Popeyes told to Newsweek it has "terminated the franchise agreement" with the location in the video and says the employee "is currently receiving his full pay."

node.title: 11 states sue to block Biden vaccine rule for businesses
node.description: New OSHA regulations are "unconstitutional, unlawful and unwise," argues one state attorney general joining the suit.

node.title: The N.Y.C. Marathon by the Numbers
node.description: Here's a look at some numbers behind the 50th running of the New York City Marathon.

node.title: The Fastest Man Ever to Run the New York City Marathon Has Arrived
node.description: In 2019, Kenenisa Bekele came within two seconds of breaking Eliud Kipchoge’s world record. At 39, the Ethiopian champion has come to New York to prove he can still win anywhere.

node.title: Lawyers for the three accused killers are expected to cite a citizen’s arrest law.
node.description: Lawyers are expected to argue that when Ahmaud Arbery was killed, the men accused of murder were trying to make a citizen’s arrest permitted under state law.

node.title: French Village Mayor Appeals for Help as Migrants Flood Shores on Trek to Britain
node.description: The influx of people making the journey has seen several migrants injured and even killed, while increasingly frequent clashes add to the disarray.

node.title: Krimpets added to Tastykake recall over possible metal pieces
node.description: Potentially tainted cupcakes and cake treats were sold by retailers across the nation, including Target and Walmart.

node.title: Tell Us Your Abortion Story
node.description: We want to hear about your experience in your own voice.
